node.title: India to repeal controversial farm laws after more than a year of protests
node.description: The controversial farm laws were passed in September last year, prompting widespread protests from farmers who argued the law would shatter their livelihoods.
node.content:
["Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced the repeal of three controversial farm laws against which farmers have protested for more than a year, representing a significant backdown by the government.", "Mr Modi made the surprise announcement during a televised speech that was broadcast live.\u00a0", "\"In the parliament session starting later this month, we will complete the constitutional process to repeal these three agricultural laws.\"", "", "
While the farmers\u2019 protests have been largely peaceful, last month eight people were killed in a deadly escalation of the year-long demonstration.\u00a0(AP: Rafiq Maqbool)
", "
Shock announcement after year-long protest\u00a0
", "The announcement came on the day of the Guru Purab festival, when Sikhism founder Guru Nanak\u2019s birthday is celebrated, and ahead of key elections in states like Uttar Pradesh and Punjab.", "Most of the protesters were Sikh farmers from Punjab.", "The government had so far yielded very little to the drawn-out demonstrations that posed one of the biggest political challenges to Mr\u00a0Modi, who swept polls for the second time in 2019.", "In November last year, the farmers escalated their movement by hunkering down on the outskirts of New Delhi, where they have camped out for nearly a year.", "While the protest movement has been largely peaceful, demonstrators in January broke through police barricades to storm the historic Red Fort in New Delhi, with clashes with police\u00a0leaving one protester dead and hundreds injured.", "Last month, eight people were killed in Uttar Pradesh\u00a0state in a deadly escalation of the demonstration.", "", "
The protests posed one of the biggest political challenges to the Indian PM, who swept polls for a second time in 2019.(Reuters:\u00a0Amit Dave)
", "
Government failed to convince farmers, Indian PM admits
", "Mr Modi said the laws were meant to empower small farmers, but he admitted the government failed to convince some who opposed\u00a0the reforms.\u00a0", "The legislation the farmers object to, introduced in September last year, deregulates the sector, allowing farmers to sell produce to buyers beyond government-regulated wholesale markets, where growers are assured of a minimum price.", "The government had defended the reforms, saying they were necessary to modernise\u00a0India's agricultural sector and to boost production through private investment.\u00a0", "But small farmers protested, saying the laws would devastate their earnings by ending guaranteed pricing and forcing\u00a0them to sell their crops to corporations at cheaper prices.", "The government has argued reform of the sector, which accounts for about 15 per cent of the economy, would bring new opportunities and better prices for farmers.", "ABC / wires"]
